page.title: 12ALL SAINT'S CHURCH.....
page.content: All Saints church is in the parish of Speke. It has a good congregation,and an experienced vicar - Reverend Amos. Work on the church began in 1871,the church having been a place of worship for over 100 years. It has had only 8 vicars in that time-they must have all liked working there. During that time there have been 2,390 weddings, 4,239 christenings and 711 funerals. Sadly there is a lot of vandalism,the church-hall needs a lot of money spending on it,and the lych-gate needs repair.The church itself is a compact, homely building with a welcoming atmosphere. Joy Simson is the organist,she also teaches the choir of over 20. Reverend Amos has 4 robes for different occasions,and enjoys "All Saints". Written by Sharon Wycherley.
